channel.title: [PI] Lil help? Rep+
channel.description: Question: If you have item 1 and 2 and item 3, you use 1 on item 2 it deletes 1, 2 and 3 and gives you another item, how do I do that?

item.title: [PI] Lil help? Rep+
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

[quote=“emtrescue, post:4, topic:400216”]intstead of hasitem its playerhasitem < search for it i have worng caps but it should work wit playerhasitem[/quote]Your an idiot… Doing that would make everything ABOVE that working. That means the ID he wants is not included…

Hawkgames, try both of our codes and tell me what you come out with.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Lil help? Rep+
item.dc:creator: @hawkgames hawkgames
item.description:
@hawkgames wrote:

But I just made this code, would it work?

if (itemUsed == 1001 && useWith == 1002 && useWith == 1003) { c.getItems().deleteItem(1001, 1); c.getItems().deleteItem(1002, 1); c.getItems().deleteItem(1003, 1); c.getItems().addItem(1004, 1); }

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Lil help? Rep+
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

if (c.getItems().hasItem(####) && itemUsed == #### && useWith == ####) {
c.getItems().deleteItem(####, 1);
c.getItems().deleteItem(####, 1);
c.getItems().deleteItem(####, 1);
c.getItems().addItem(####, 1);
}

Try that. Put it in UseItem.java

Read full topic
